96DE043927834543AD616F81290C6317.description: LA09.E.41: acquire and use accurately general academic and domain-specific words and phrases, sufficient for reading, writing, speaking, and listening at the college and career readiness level; demonstrate independence in gathering vocabulary knowledge when considering a word or phrase important to comprehension or expression

C60779AC07154039A32A78D7FD2C4885.description: LA09.E.40.b: analyze nuances in the meaning of words with similar denotations

694F620BBA3C4B1CA3D4801622537049.description: LA09.E.40.a: interpret figures of speech (e.g., euphemism, oxymoron) in context and analyze their role in the text

24D3B3947DC34D788A4D0E9E957AED58.description: LA09.E.40: demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and nuances in word meanings

9B1D9E556877491B9B4A7BF9CDD2ECA0.description: LA09.E.39.e: verify the preliminary determination of the meaning of a word or phrase (e.g., by checking the inferred meaning in context or in a dictionary)

88F95CA0635B4CC9B92D3B43C368A47A.description: LA09.E.39.d: consult general and specialized reference materials (e.g., dictionaries, glossaries, thesauruses), both print and digital, to find the pronunciation of a word or determine or clarify its precise meaning, its part of speech, or its etymology

4E053789225C405D841FFD4267D337AD.description: LA09.E.39.c: identify and correctly use patterns of word changes that indicate different meanings or parts of speech (e.g., analyze, analysis, analytical; advocate, advocacy)

F39AC899D8B2409AAAF96D5FB8072FE7.description: LA09.E.39.b: use common, grade-appropriate Greek and Latin roots as clues to the meanings of words or phrases (e.g., submarine, submerge, suburban)

9B9976838DA649BA92B22160D8159DF3.description: LA09.E.39.a: use context (e.g., the overall meaning of a sentence, paragraph, or text; a word's position or function in a sentence) as a clue to the meaning of a word or phrase

ABA34BAC4ACA4C72B7BCA923B1722965.description: LA09.E.39: determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on grades 9-10 reading and content, choosing flexibly from a range of strategies

62A0A9EE282140428EB07E5EB07296B3.description: LA09.E.38.a: write and edit work so that it conforms to the guidelines in a style manual (e.g., MLA Handbook, Turabian's Manual for Writers) appropriate for the discipline and writing type

8EB3ABF35E02424297BA9AD850502102.description: LA09.E.38: apply knowledge of language to understand how language functions in different contexts, to make effective choices for meaning or style, to comprehend more fully when reading or listening

30570D5502B046078D164AEED5E421F0.description: LA09.E.37.b: use a colon to introduce a list or quotation

CBEC64A89FF84F5C96B38A0683B78C9D.description: LA09.E.37.a: use a semicolon (and perhaps a conjunctive adverb) to link two or more closely related independent clauses

BEA9C85F5F62483E8926CD17525B165A.description: LA09.E.37: demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling when writing

69F9382AFC6A499C947E376667A90D2B.description: LA09.E.36.b: use various types of phrases (noun, verb, adjectival, adverbial, participial, prepositional, absolute) and clauses (independent, dependent; noun, relative, adverbial) to convey specific meanings and add variety and interest to writing or presentations

27C5D52CB60D4F778BC3CA88673617D0.description: LA09.E.36: demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking

08094AD9C4F24AAE88F830BA6F8D570B.description: LA09.D.35: adapt speech to a variety of contexts and tasks, demonstrating command of formal English when indicated or appropriate

220EF89E021442DDA044A02E31C8E240.description: LA09.D.34: make strategic use of digital media (e.g., textual, graphical, audio, visual, and interactive elements) in presentations to enhance understanding of findings, reasoning, and evidence and to add interest

661C5BD952244FCA8429174127DC6F0A.description: LA09.D.33: present information, findings, and supporting evidence clearly, concisely, and logically such that listeners can follow the line of reasoning and the organization, development, substance, and style are appropriate to purpose, audience, and task

8615966C3C2F446893AF63236C7F2811.description: LA09.D.32: evaluate and/or reflect on a speaker's point of view, reasoning, and use of evidence and rhetoric, identifying any fallacious reasoning or exaggerated or distorted evidence

F9B7E9BF7F65481482B7A25E31E2D6D7.description: LA09.D.30: initiate and participate effectively in a range of collaborative discussions (e.g., one-on-one, in groups, and teacher-led) with diverse partners on grades 9-10 topics, texts, and issues, building on others' ideas and expressing their own clearly and persuasively

2D618882AEE14013AEBFEA5C10728F2F.description: LA09.D.30.d: respond thoughtfully to diverse perspectives, summarize points of agreement and disagreement, and, when warranted, qualify or justify their own views and understanding and make new connections in light of the evidence and reasoning presented

E2CDBE42058F43209AD71454B8060335.description: LA09.D.30.c: propel conversations by posing and responding to questions that relate the current discussion to broader themes or larger ideas; actively incorporate others into the discussion; and clarify, verify, or challenge ideas and conclusions

CDE3B616D5DD457EAF6454198DAA56D6.description: LA09.D.30.b: work with peers to set rules for collegial discussions and decision-making (e.g., informal consensus, taking votes on key issues, presentation of alternate views), clear goals and deadlines, and individual roles as needed

C9BFDEDAA554488B9F41C106FAAB1D4B.description: LA09.D.30.a: come to discussions prepared, having read and researched material under study; explicitly draw on that preparation by referring to evidence from texts and other research on the topic or issue to stimulate a thoughtful, well-reasoned exchange of ideas

BC963F98E6D64E3B8228C4EA52DB8FAB.description: LA09.D.30: initiate and participate effectively in a range of collaborative discussions (e.g., one-on-one, in groups, and teacher-led) with diverse partners on grades 9-10 topics, texts, and issues, building on others' ideas and expressing their own clearly and persuasively

3FB4A6B3EBF7477FA3CDC2DBE01B5010.description: LA09.C.29: write routinely over extended time frames (time for research, reflection, and revision) and shorter time frames (a single sitting or a day or two) for a range of tasks, purposes, and audiences

A7DB0D76D94D47E190F4496C1C7AEE5C.description: LA09.C.28.f: produce a written reflection to informational texts that reflects on the meaning and value of a piece of writing

06B60EC0B0A74F6E98473E25D39AC590.description: LA09.C.28.e: produce a written reflection to literature and literary nonfiction that reflects on the meaning and value of a piece of writing

8F9BB5279F09437095DFA663E2529C4F.description: LA09.C.28.d: produce a written critical analysis to informational texts that draws evidence from the text

5F0A46A5F22747DDAD436CCBE35E6DD1.description: LA09.C.28.c: produce a written critical analysis to literature and literary nonfiction that draws evidence from the text

D2AB2BEE04D34456836C6345D5270ED1.description: LA09.C.28.b: apply grades 9-10 reading standards to informational texts (e.g., delineate and evaluate the argument and specific claims in a text, assessing whether the reasoning is valid and the evidence is relevant and sufficient; identify false statements and fallacious reasoning")

0F4061FD146F46B6B263E801B742E95D.description: LA09.C.28.a: apply grades 9-10 reading standards to literature and literary nonfiction (e.g., analyze how an author draws on and transforms source material in a specific work [e.g., how Shakespeare treats a theme or topic from Ovid or the Bible or how a later author draws on a play by Shakespeare])

DF5E3F4B91BC4E3DA04F59C1333219EC.description: LA09.C.28: draw evidence from literary or informational texts to support analysis, reflection, and research

A86448FE6EAF4E8BB59463F5E441B8C1.description: LA09.C.27: gather relevant information from multiple authoritative print and digital sources, using advanced searches effectively; assess the usefulness of each source in answering the research question; integrate information into the text selectively to maintain the flow of ideas, avoiding plagiarism and following a standard format for citations

469FFB7040D84CA69ECFA9F4F05D5373.description: LA09.C.26: conduct short, as well as more sustained, research projects to answer questions (including self-generated questions) or solve problems; narrow or broaden inquiries when appropriate; synthesize multiple sources on the subjects, demonstrating understanding of the subject under investigation

D795D4081EE94EA0B6CB9CF81037EEA5.description: LA09.C.25: use technology, including the Internet, to produce, publish, and update individual or shared writing products, taking advantage of technology's capacity to link to other information and to display information flexibly and dynamically

5AF56E9506D946EAA340A85DA51971A7.description: LA09.C.24: develop and strengthen writing as needed by planning, revising, editing, rewriting, or trying a new approach, focusing on addressing what is most significant for a specific purpose and audience

9A2EE9166FC14FBF83544177083B908A.description: LA09.C.23: produce clear and coherent writing in which the development, organization, and style are appropriate to task, purpose, and audience

7EF71209FBA0400C93BB72872C04DE2F.description: LA09.C.22.e: provide a conclusion that follows from and reflects on what is experienced, observed, or resolved over the course of the narrative

449B16E80CA945D59CC35D8E0C544254.description: LA09.C.22.d: use precise words and phrases, telling details, and sensory language to convey a vivid picture of the experiences, events, setting, and/or characters

4AF9B0B547F743C19B06EC48DF94E562.description: LA09.C.22.c: use a variety of techniques to sequence events so that they build on one another to create a coherent whole

5504E909E8974957A97B35C87B695877.description: LA09.C.22.b: use narrative techniques, such as dialogue, pacing, description, reflection, and multiple plot lines, to develop experiences, events, and/or characters

93834942C5DC41529FA0F610DC0F3761.description: LA09.C.22.a: engage and orient the reader by setting out a problem, situation, or observation, establishing one or multiple point(s) of view, and introducing a narrator and/or characters; create a smooth progression of experiences or events

1F1C0937C23C4D00933D6114D98490EE.description: LA09.C.22: write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events, using effective technique, well-chosen details, and well-structured event sequences

2769259E6DEA4F2BB7E7956B4F16B6BD.description: LA09.C.21.g: provide a concluding statement or section that follows from and supports the information or explanation presented (e.g., articulating implications or the significance of the topic)

270D8ADB548C4558B7DA4D4400E91D98.description: LA09.C.21.f: use documents to clarify details or support claims

4790E918197D4AF4B66F4D81D388263E.description: LA09.C.21.e: establish and maintain an appropriate style and objective tone

CC7A6C2D59264AAF983134A6523AC660.description: LA09.C.21.d: use precise language and domain-specific vocabulary to manage the complexity of the topic

9F398C196B0A451A84866ED04C5E67D0.description: LA09.C.21.c: use appropriate and varied transitions to link the major sections of the text, create cohesion, and clarify the relationships among complex ideas and concepts

448B3D73ED924CF4AB6BEB720FEE4E60.description: LA09.C.21.b: develop the topic with well-chosen, relevant, and sufficient facts, extended definitions, concrete details, quotations, or other information and examples appropriate to the audience's knowledge of the topic

26B86971BABB4398B98A17C7FF65B7D2.description: LA09.C.21.a: introduce a topic; organize complex ideas, concepts, and information to make important connections and distinctions; include formatting (e.g., headings), graphics (e.g., figures, tables), and multimedia when useful to aiding comprehension

9953295AD2694ADF941FF08FA293E07F.description: LA09.C.21: write informative/explanatory texts to examine and convey complex ideas, concepts, and information clearly and accurately through the effective selection, organization, and analysis of content

1F759278084E4B3DA94A790F8A08B8EA.description: LA09.C.20.e: provide a concluding statement or section that follows from and supports the argument presented

AE2869DB15F14D1F962B65BD97C83E72.description: LA09.C.20.d: establish and maintain an appropriate style and objective tone, while attending to the norms and conventions of the discipline in which they are writing

5F297DADD7D841FFB7706F774C27E6C7.description: LA09.C.20.c: use words, phrases, and clauses to link the major sections of the text, create cohesion, and clarify the relationships between claim(s) and reasons, between reasons and evidence, and between claim(s) and counterclaims

10B51A80F9694398B0172FFD9C82274F.description: LA09.C.20.b: develop claim(s) and counterclaims fairly, supplying evidence for each while pointing out the strengths and limitations of both in a manner that anticipates the audience's knowledge level and concerns

D0E16485607943ECB0CDBB0F342470F5.description: LA09.C.20.a: introduce precise claim(s), distinguish the claim(s) from alternate or opposing claims, and create an organization that establishes clear relationships among claim(s), counterclaims, reasons, and evidence

093A9357BED547078B4DD2182C8A4615.description: LA09.C.20: write arguments to support claims in an analysis of substantive topics or texts, using valid reasoning and relevant and sufficient evidence

01BF125CE7C048F4BDE33C61C38E4920.description: LA09.B.19: read and comprehend informational texts in the grades 9-10 text complexity band proficiently by the end of grade 9

7F352693E5D142AE9667DB44BE728266.description: LA09.B.18.a: relate a literary work to primary source documents of its literary period or historical setting

34792C5BF0FF410D9F79BEE88536E112.description: LA09.B.18: analyze seminal U.S. documents of historical and literary significance (e.g., Washington's Farewell Address, the Gettysburg Address, Roosevelt's Four Freedoms speech, King's "Letter from Birmingham Jail," Nelson Mandela's Nobel Peace Prize Speech, The Universal Declaration of Human Rights), including how they address related themes and concepts

8B31085B7D2642409BF8CA7F53A34A7B.description: LA09.B.17: delineate and evaluate the argument and specific claims in a text, assessing whether the reasoning is valid and the evidence is relevant and sufficient; identify false statements and fallacious reasoning

A6434AE1D4614EADBDD3FBC72A169315.description: LA09.B.16: analyze various accounts of a subject told in different mediums (e.g., a person's life story in both print and multimedia), determining which details are emphasized in each account

36BDE85B3F0D447FBA040D6B741ECEC4.description: LA09.B.15: determine an author's point of view or purpose in a text and analyze how an author uses rhetoric to advance that point of view or purpose

C754DA6E8415498BA860B5B804B2A490.description: LA09.B.14: analyze in detail how an author's ideas or claims are developed and refined by particular sentences, paragraphs, or larger portions of a text (e.g., a section or chapter)

4F5775FB28DF4CADBD96AD4AA8BCC200.description: LA09.B.13: determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text, including figurative, connotative, and technical meanings; analyze the cumulative impact of specific word choices on meaning and tone (e.g., how the language of a court opinion differs from that of a newspaper)

0A10376502DE4299A9A81C0DF6EB274C.description: LA09.B.12: analyze how the author unfolds an analysis or series of ideas or events, including the order in which the points are made, how they are introduced and developed, and the connections that are drawn between them

2B1C7769F4A34C0680AB43E27F1E3033.description: LA09.B.11: determine a central idea of a text and analyze its development over the course of the text, including how it emerges and is shaped and refined by specific details; provide an objective summary of the text

19661F20A5B241D7886CD3069ECA1D36.description: LA09.B.10: cite strong and thorough textual evidence to support analysis of what the text says explicitly as well as inferences drawn from the text

4F97B9A14C864FF7ABBDD07808F8D2BC.description: LA09.A.9: read and comprehend literature and literary nonfiction, including stories, dramas, and poems, at the high end of the grades 9-10 text complexity band independently and proficiently, with scaffolding as needed at the high end of the range, by the end of grade 9

92F9E6879DB24B4F88E1C6471B69239D.description: LA09.A.8: analyze how an author draws on and transforms source material in a specific work (e.g., how Shakespeare treats a theme or topic from Ovid or the Bible or how a later author draws on a play by Shakespeare)

94D687F8BDA14173B11613B8EACA1341.description: LA09.A.7: analyze the representation of a subject or a key scene in two different artistic mediums (e.g., Auden's poem "Musee des Beaux Arts" and Breughel's painting Landscape with the Fall of Icarus), including what is emphasized or absent in each treatment

D5EA486EFD374883A0FE40FDCBBD4E74.description: LA09.A.6: analyze a particular point of view or cultural experience reflected in a work of literature from outside the United States, drawing on a wide reading of world literature

D53408AB1CF742E3AEFC5328B9A8EC9E.description: LA09.A.5: analyze how an author's choices concerning how to structure a text, order events within it (e.g., parallel plots), and manipulate time (e.g., pacing, flashbacks) create such effects as mystery, tension, or surprise

0A3111EDEDE44268B65B0F8808437EA9.description: LA09.A.4: determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in the text, including figurative and connotative meanings; analyze the cumulative impact of specific word choices on meaning and tone (e.g., how the language evokes a sense of time and place; how it sets a formal or informal tone)

21580DDCAF63481CBA24B712439557E0.description: LA09.A.3: analyze how complex characters (e.g., those with multiple or conflicting motivations) develop over the course of a text, interact with other characters, and advance the plot or develop the theme

EC4A7ED36A2E4695A163614687D51AAD.description: LA09.A.2: determine a theme or central idea of a text and closely analyze its development over the course of the text, including how it emerges and is shaped and refined by specific details; provide an objective summary of the text

48CB6F96CD3E4699BC581616809B8FF8.description: LA09.A.1: cite strong and thorough textual evidence to support analysis of what the text says explicitly as well as inferences drawn from the text
